column2: MISSISSIPPI DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Mississippi

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Turn left or go through

column2: 2. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 4. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: Yield

column2: 5. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 6. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.
column8: place their foot on the accelerator.

column2: 7. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 8. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: do not enter

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Work work ahead

column2: 10. To be able to turn quickly, your hands should be:
column4: next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.
column6: on the steering wheel, so they are at the 6 and 12 o'clock positions.
column8: placed outside of the steering wheel on opposite sides

column2: 11. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 12. Stopping distances:
column4: are not affected by vehicle speed.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: Open intersection ahead

column2: 14. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To halt the traffic flow.
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 15. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: a divided highway ends ahead.
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Merging Traffic

column2: 17. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
column6: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column8: oncoming vehicles might not see you.

column2: 18. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: causes the front wheels to lock.
column6: is the best option during winter.

column2: 19. Driver distractions include:
column4: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
column6: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

column2: 20. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 21. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: on the entrance ramp.
column6: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 22. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 23. Blind spots are:
column4: traffic control devices.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column8: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

column2: 24. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column6: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column8: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.

column2: 25. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 26. When you change lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column8: look in the left side mirror.

column2: 27. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
column4: improves traffic flow.

column2: 28. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column4: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column8: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 29. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: drive at a constant speed.

column2: 30. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
